stories.text:
Hello from your friendly co-tinkerer and misfit!

I needed a better method to manage 3 and 4 button gestures on Linux laptops. I wrote `Swipe Linux Gestures` to suite my requirements. Since it works well for me, I am sure this would be useful for others.

You can download the binary or build it yourself. See: https://github.com/evuraan/Swipe or https://evuraan.info/Swipe/

Have a good day!
stories.title: Swipe: Gestures on Linux

stories.text:
Hey all, I’m working on a free online flowchart editor. Its optimized for speed via keyboard shortcuts and a compact UI:

knotend.com

I’m looking for feedback so I can make it better. I did a Show HN a few months back (below) and have made updates based on what people said then. It was mostly about usability and confusion for first time users.

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=27256861
stories.title: Ask HN: Feedback on My Flowchart Editor?
Stop taking manual meeting minutes with this hack
